intro: Diascia cardiosepala, commonly known as the heartleaf diascia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly heart-shaped base, giving it its common name. The flowers bloom in clusters and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
